moves.1. b3 e5 2. Bb2 Nc6 3. Nf3 e4 4. Nd4 Nf6: Usually, Black takes my knight in this position, but he lets me mess with his pawns instead.
moves.6. Nxc6 dxc6 7. d4 exd3 e.p. 8. Bxd3 Bg4: I thought he was going to castle queenside.
moves.11. Nd2 O-O 12. Bxf6 gxf6: What a surprise! After Qxf6, I was going to play Ne4 and get rid of his strong black bishop. That's why I was willing to trade mine off. But I didn't expect him to open up his kingside and give himself double, isolated pawns.
moves.13. Nc4 Rd5 14. a3 b5: That's what I was expecting when I put the knight on c4. Now it gets relocated to e4.
I don't feel great about this move. I feel like I'm daring him to take on f5, which doubles my pawns. But I feel there are too many pieces pointed at my kingside.
moves.19... Bxf5 20. exf5 h4: I've got to worry about him playing a3.
moves.21. Kh1 Bd4 22. Rb1 Qd6 23. f4: That was another dangerous move for me. It blocks out his queen for now, but now my king's trapped.
moves.23... Rg7 24. Rf3: So I can meet h3 with Rxh3.
moves.24... Rg4 25. b4: This is like giving him a free move, but my queen's stuck on c1, guarding that pawn on a3, unless I play b4.
moves.25... Re8: And, of course, he stops me from being able to play Qe1.
moves.26. Qf1 h3:
If I play gxh3, he gets to play Rg1+.
If I play Rxh3, he plays Rxf4.
That leaves the awful g3, and my king is trapped plus my rook is pinned after he moves the queen to d5.
moves.27. g3 Qd5: As expected. My only choice is to continue the plan I started and play c4.
moves.28. c4 bxc4 29. Bxc4 Qxf5 30. Qd3 Qd7: I think he's going to have some problems with that pinned bishop.
moves.31. Rd1 c5: I'm not sure what that does for him. It separates my pawns; it gives his queen another diagonal -- but I'm not sure it's worth the pawn.
moves.32. bxc5 Rd8 33. Qb3: Now that the pawn's off of this file, my queen can use it, too.
moves.33... Rg7 34. Bf1 Rh7 35. Qb7: I especially have to keep his queen off of that long diagonal and not let it pin my rook.
moves.35... Qe7 36. Qc6 f5 37. a4 Kg7 38. Rfd3:
Looks like we're heading for a draw, but I don't have any reason to avoid it. Our team's up 2-1 with this as the last remaining game.

(Draw accepted)
